content.description: Start on holds to the right of the horn on the east corner of the boulder.  Climb to top.
content.location: If you're standing with your back to the wall where 'NOAH' is etched, start on the holds that will be slightly out around to your left on the large boulder that you're facing. (#61 in MK pocket guide?)

content.description: Move up along a right-leaning seam then up the face with the water streak.  Top out.
content.location: To the right of the large lodged boulder.  #55 in the MK pocket guide.

content.description: Both hands start on two separate two finger pockets beneath a four finger pocket.  Top out.
content.protection: Pad.  A spotter can be nice because of the rock behind you.
content.location: To the right of the right-leaning seam and to the left of where someone has scratched what appears to be the name 'NOAH' onto the wall.  #56 in the MK pocket guide.

content.description: Start on far left arete, traverse right on your choice of crimps and sidepulls about halfway across the southeast face and climb up to top.
content.location: If you're facing Split Ya Pants, it's the boulder directly to your left.

content.description: Start low on pockets on the wall on the far right of the wall (next to the large crack).  Climb up, veering right, to top.You could climb this route with a few pads and some good spotters -- the landing is very slanted and chances that you would slide down the hill after hitting a pad are high -- or you could do some rigging to get a toprope line from the anchors of 'Man School' over to the edge of the boulder (the original hanger for the toprope bolt on this route is missing for whatever reason, but you can still find the bolt itself in the rock to use as a kind of marker if you wanted to for a direction to climb towards).
content.location: From the alcove with 'Split Ya Pants' and 'Holy Acorn' looking out over the wash you'll be able to find the old toprope bolt for this route on the edge of the ledge closest to the road. There's several different ways you can scramble down to the bottom, so choose your adventure.  #62 in the Marty Map.

content.description: Climb the face to the right of the lodged boulder.
content.protection: Pad.  A spotter can be nice because of the rocks behind you.
content.location: Start between lodged boulder and the right-leaning seam, variety of small pockets to use for hands.  #54 in MK pocket guide.

content.description: Start with right hand in a mono pocket and left hand in a three finger pocket.  Top out.  Boulder on your right is off.
content.location: On the wall between the tree and a lodged boulder.  #52 in MK pocket guide.

content.description: A cluster of boulders near the Campground Boulder.  A decent amount of the problems can be protected by pad(s) and spotters but there's quite a few top rope problems in the area as well. Most of the problems here stay shaded for the majority of the morning.
